title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: First a phone interview and after 3 weeks they invited me for a site interview. They were extreme nice people. Beautiful campus and small college town. The dean called me after a month and gave me the offer.
Interview Questions: Typical faculty position questions. I had to do a quick presentation on my research and did one teaching demo. There were around 60 students in class and they were listening to my teaching very very carefully. Overall, very nice experience.

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: Easy the interview was over the phone asked a few questions and it worked out even as a freshman. I was the only person in that grade to get the job
Interview Questions: Do you have any job experience?

title: Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a fantastic experience. Friendly, high levels of customer service, personable, and timely responses. The search committee was open and transparent and had representation from relevant offices.
Interview Questions: A question related to equity and inclusion through enrollment management.

title: IT Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CSU Chico in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: In-person, and 1 hours of interview, and interview is mostly based on the background of student and if they can grasp the functions of IT. Other than that it is pretty well streamlined and it should be all set.
Interview Questions: Do you know about IoT Do you have experience about how Tdx operates

title: International Students Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Chico in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Video interview via zoom for about 20 minutes. There were 5 interviewers and took turns asking their questions. They had 10 questions with me and mainly asked about my previous work experience, and how was that relevant to their job description. They were also interested in hearing about soft and hard skills, what activities and events would I plan for the students if hired. Other questions were related to the university and the job role, how would I benefit the company on that position, how do I act in conflicting situations, etc
Interview Questions: Remember an incident or a conflict at work, and how did you solve?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: It was a student position. They asked about internship experience, personal skills, emotional skills, hobby's and goals. They asked about my vision for the role and what I would like to get out of it as a student employee
Interview Questions: What design skills do you bring to this position?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: I did an application and after we did a lot of workshops prior to actually making an interview appointment. You sit down with two people and they ask you general questions as well as scenarios.
Interview Questions: If you continue to see vomit as well beer cans in the bathroom, what do you do?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviewers at the first interview, and more senior people at the second as well as real-life scenarios of how you would handle certain situations with residents.  It was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: STEMCAT Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I walked into an office with the hiring manager and simply answered a few application questions. She went down the list and after she was finished she asked to hear about my background to see if I would be a good candidate.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you'd make a good mentor?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, Just showed interest and when a position opened up i was approached about the job. This is because of the close nit nature of the physics department. I liked the job i did and it was not very hard to do. There was a lot to learn , but not hard stuff.
Interview Questions: They basically just wanted to make sure I had the first 3 undergrad physics courses (mechanics, E&M and Heat/light/waves/sound/etc. These are what classes I was to set up labs for.

title: Administrative Support Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: Very basic behavioral questions, but the process was very short and the focus of the interview was more on technical skills. I think the interview will depend on what department you are looking for the ASA position in.
Interview Questions: What entices you about working for a CSU?

title: Inclusion Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: First you submit an application for review. In the application you are asked to answer an essay question on why you believe you would be a good candidate for the position. No cover letter was required. After submitting an application and scheduling an interview you would attend an interactive group interview wearing casual clothes. If you pass the group interview then you would receive an email and come into the office to schedule an individual interview will be called back for an individual interview where you would wear professional clothes.
Interview Questions: How are you with time management?

title: Administrative Support Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: This was a panel interview. The hiring supervisor and two other employees and myself all sat around a table and they asked simple questions and I answered accordingly. This was a relaxed interview that I actually enjoyed . I felt as though I was hanging out talking with the girls.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience with excel

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward, basically just tested my people skills. Met on two levels and had to go through two rounds, which handled similar topics, related to customer service as well as responsibilities the job entailed.
Interview Questions: Do you like meeting new people and can you connect easily with others?

title: Centeal Office Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
All behavioral questions 
Small computer practical. Very simple
Very simple and all the staff is was great. 
Asked some situational questions but very basic for a desk job
Explained very little of all the attributes of the job but you become accustomed to doing random jobs
Interview Questions: Why should you get this job?

title: Yearbook Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
You are required to answer a set of questions they asked you during the interview. 
How well you know the programs you are going to use. If you are fit for a classroom environment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Cook I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Chico in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, ask a series of questions off a printed sheet of paper. Situational questions. Panel didn't seem concerned with process. Had to take a physical. Took months to start working after I applied. Had to meet w director 1:1 after panel interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you were faced w adversity and how did you deal with it.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CSU Chico
Interview Descriptions: University Housing and Food Service. First you go through the RA class. Then you go through individual interviews as well as group interviews. Group interviews involve team building and policy questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met the coordinator who turned out to be very nice after applying through the student job portal.Unfortunately by the time I met her the position was filled up but we still had a great discussion about my background and my skills.She made me to fill up a form and promised I ll get a call once anything comes up. It happened sooner than I thought, few days later I got a call from the office confirming that they were ready to offer me the position of student assistant although it was just 6 hours per week, I never hesitated to join them as I knew It is a great place to work and eventually after a semester I got full hours and enjoyed my time there after that.
Interview Questions:
Educational background questions.
Yours course interest and overall personality and its connection towards working at a place which caters to the needs of disabled students is assessed.

title: Social Media and Photography Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three people. They asked a series of questions pertaining to my experience and how I would improve Chico State's brand. I already felt a warm welcome by the interviewers from the moment I walked into the room. I was nervous, of course, but they made me feel at ease. They asked questions I was expecting for a social media role.
Interview Questions: How do you use Instagram both personally and professionally?

title: Student Caller/Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process is strict; they are looking for outgoing, personable individuals who are willing to speak with anyone and everyone. Typical questions are asked about your ability to converse with people, and your willingness to ask for high amounts of money from nearly everyone, be it a retired senior, mom with kids, recent graduate, etc.
Interview Questions: You WILL be asked about your favorite movie, and expected to explain it to them as a sales pitch, rather than a plot summary or description of what takes place.

title: Web Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: All interviews were done with a panel of 4-5 people. I was brought in once for an initial interview and for a second follow up interview after that. Mostly they wanted to see a strong portfolio and demonstrated ability with web.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between different image formats (jpeg, png) and

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, submit application after printing it out from the internet by a certain date and nearly everyone is granted an interview. After the interview process is complete, they call back offering certain time slots that may be available to see who would be able to fill them. Often times, the only way to get the position is to take a time slot during the graveyard shift, but after a semester, DAs can pick whatever time slots they want.
Interview Questions: What is your class schedule like?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: There was a simple application that would take a minimum of time to fill out. The interview was relaxed as the person in charge of the tutors really wanted to know how you were planning on helping the students, what training you had received to that end, how extensive your knowledge of the subject matter was, what your people and communication skills were like, and where your interests lie outside of school and work.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question revolved around explaining subject matter to tutees and about how you would explain something that the student just didn't seem to be understanding.

title: TEach for Americah Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CSU Chico (Chico, CA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Rather easy. Thought I blew it but did get a call back
Interview Questions: How do you organize
